intro: Hypochaeris echegarayi, commonly known as the Echegaray's weed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in grasslands and open areas. It produces yellow flowers with ray florets, and its leaves are usually hairy and alternate. Hypochaeris echegarayi is often considered a weed but has ecological significance in its native habitat.
